questiontext.text:
A chord XY of length \({@XY@}\,\text{}\) is drawn in a circle with centre O and radius \({@XO@}\,\text{}\), as shown in the figure below.

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-12, 12, 12, -12], axis: false, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); /* Points: dots removed, labels kept */ var X = board.create('point', [-7, 0], { name: 'X', size: 0, strokeOpacity: 0, fillOpacity: 0, label: { offset: [-12, 8] } // outside the circle }); var Y = board.create('point', [7, 0], { name: 'Y', size: 0, strokeOpacity: 0, fillOpacity: 0 }); var N = board.create('midpoint', [X, Y], { name: 'N', size: 0, strokeOpacity: 0, fillOpacity: 0 }); var ON = Math.sqrt(64 - 49); // √15 var O = board.create('point', [0, ON], { name: 'O', size: 0, strokeOpacity: 0, fillOpacity: 0 }); /* Constructions */ board.create('circle', [O, X]); board.create('segment', [X, Y]); board.create('segment', [O, N], {straightFirst:false, straightLast:false}); board.create('segment', [O, X]); board.create('segment', [O, Y]); /* Text labels */ board.create('text', [-3, ON - 0.5, '{#XO#} cm']); board.create('text', [-1, -0.8, '{#XY#} cm']); board.create('text', [0, -5, 'P ']); // Right angle at N between NO and NX var aONX = board.create('angle', [O, N, X], { radius: 1, withLabel: false, // no angle text type: 'sector', // classic angle mark orthoSensitivity: 1 // treat as right angle }); [[/jsxgraph]]

Calculate the following:

  1. The distance ON.

    \(\text{ON}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. The area of the sector OXPY.

    \(\text{Area of a sector}=\)[[input:ans2]]\(\,\text{cm}^2\)[[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]] \(\text{Correct to 3 d.p}\)

  3. The area of triangle OXY.

    \(\text{Area of a triangle}=\)[[input:ans3]]\(\,\text{cm}^2\)[[validation:ans3]][[feedback:prt3]]

  4. The area of the minor segment.

    \(\text{Area of minor segment}=\)[[input:ans4]]\(\,\text{cm}^2\)[[validation:ans4]][[feedback:prt4]] \(\text{Correct to 3 d.p}\)

  5. The area of the major segment.

    \(\text{Area of major segment}=\)[[input:ans5]]\(\,\text{cm}^2\)[[validation:ans5]][[feedback:prt5]] \(\text{Correct to 3 d.p}\)

generalfeedback.text:
1. Distance ON

    Since N is the midpoint of XY, triangle ONX is right-angled at N.

    \( \begin{align} XN &= \frac{XY}{2} \\ &=\frac{{@XY@}}{2} \\ &={@XN@}\,\text{cm} \end{align} \)

    Using Pythagoras’ theorem in \(\triangle ONX\):

    \( \begin{align} ON^2 + XN^2 &= XO^2 \\ ON^2 &= {@XO@}^2 - {@XN@}^2 \\ ON &= \sqrt{{@XO@}^2 - {@XN@}^2}\\ &=\{{@ON@}\}\ \text{cm} \end{align} \)

  2. Area of sector OXPY

    In right-angled triangle ONX:

    \( \begin{align} \cos(\angle NOX) &= \frac{ON}{XO}\\ &=\frac{{@ON@}}{{@XO@}} \\ \angle \, NOX &=\cos^(-1)(\frac{{@ON@}}{{@XO@}})\\ &={@angle_NOX@} \end{align} \)

    Therefore,
    \(\angle\, XOY={@angle_NOX@} \times 2={@angle_XOY@}^\circ\)

    Area of a sector:

    \( \begin{align} \text{Area of sector} &= \frac{\angle XOY}{360} \times \pi r^2\\ &=\frac{\theta}{360} \times \frac{22}{7} \times {@XO@}^2\\ &={@area_sector@} \, \text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

    Therefore, the area of a sector \(={@area_sector@} \, \text{cm}^2\)

  3. Area of triangle OXY

    Triangle OXY has base XY and height ON.

    \( \begin{align} \text{Area of } \triangle OXY &= \frac{1}{2} \times XY \times ON \\ &=\frac{1}{2} \times {@XY@} \times {@ON@} \\ &={@area_triangle@}\,\text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

    Therefore, the area of the triangle \(={@area_triangle@} \, \text{cm}^2\)

  4. Area of the minor segment

    \( \begin{align} \text{Area of minor segment} &= \text{Area of sector} - \text{Area of } \triangle\,OXY \\ &={@area_sector1@}-{@area_triangle@} \\ &={@area_minor_segment@}\,\text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

    Therefore, the area of the minor segment \(={@area_minor_segment@} \, \text{cm}^2\)

  5. Area of the major segment

    Area of the circle:

    \( \begin{align} \text{Area of circle} &= \pi r^2\\ &=\frac{22}{7}\times {@XO@}^2\\ &={@area_circle@}\,\text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

    Therefore,
    \( \begin{align} \text{Area of major segment} &= \text{Area of circle} - \text{Area of minor segment}\\ &={@area_circle@}-{@area_minor_segment@} \\ &={@area_major_segment@}\,\text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

    Therefore, the area of the major segment \(={@area_major_segment@} \, \text{cm}^2\)

\(\text{The area of triangle}={@area_triangle@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The area of the minor segment}={@area_minor_segment@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The area of the major segment}={@area_major_segment@}\,\text{cm}\)
